org.atteo.moonshine.jetty

Class Jetty

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.atteo.evo.config.Configurable
      • org.atteo.moonshine.services.Service
        • org.atteo.moonshine.services.TopLevelService
          • org.atteo.moonshine.webserver.WebServerService
            • org.atteo.moonshine.jetty.Jetty
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class Jetty
extends WebServerService
    Starts embedded Jetty web server instance.

    There are two ways to register servlets and filters:

    • by annotating servlet with @WebServlet and filter with @WebFilter
    • by registering ServletModule in Guice

    Please note that when using annotations the ClassIndex facility is used to get the list of annotated classes as opposed to otherwise more common classpath scanning. The implication of that is that the class will be "visible" to this Jetty service only when it was compiled with webserver.jar in the classpath which contains annotation processor generating the needed class index. Use ServletModule when that is not the case.

    • Configuration

      • XML

        <!--
            Starts embedded Jetty web server instance.
        -->
        <jetty>
            <!--
                Support {@link WebServlet}, {@link WebFilter} and {@link WebInitParam} annotations
                by automatically registering annotated classes using {@link ServletModule}.
            -->
            <registerAnnotatedServlets>true</registerAnnotatedServlets>
            <sslcontextfactories>
                <? extends SslContextFactoryConfig>...</? extends SslContextFactoryConfig>
            </sslcontextfactories>
            <!-- List of connectors. -->
            <connectors>
                <? extends ConnectorConfig>new ConnectorConfig[] { new ServerConnectorConfig() }</? extends ConnectorConfig>
            </connectors>
            <!--
                Main handler. Usually a {@link HandlerCollectionConfig collection} or {@link HandlerListConfig list}
                of handlers. By default set to {@link ServletContextHandlerConfig}.
            -->
            <? extends HandlerConfig>new ServletContextHandlerConfig()</? extends HandlerConfig>
        </jetty>

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public com.google.inject.Module configure()
        Description copied from class: Service
        Returns Module which specifies this service dependencies and what it provides to other services.

        Additionally ServletModule implementation can also be returned which allows to register servlets and filters (you need appropriate service enabled which uses this info, like Jetty).

        Overrides:
        configure in class Service
        Returns:
        Guice module

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from class: Service
        Starts this service.

        All fields marked with Inject will be injected before execution of this method.

        Every functionality that is exported to other services should be started in Service.configure() method or in registered Provider. Here you can start functionalities which are used outside this application.

        Overrides:
        start in class Service

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: Service
        Closes this services, it won't be started again.

        Overrides:
